DOC.brief_summary: The aim study investigate methodological aspect may affect glycemic index ( GI ) insulinemic ( II ) value . In addition , measure GI II value typical Finnish carbohydrate-rich food provide database GIs Finnish food . The specific aim study : - compare glycemic response GIs analyze capillary venous blood compare glucose white bread reference food , study effect number reference test GI value . For set tested parameter , determine glycemic index rye bread , oatmeal porridge instant mash potato - examine glycaemic insulinaemic response mash potato-based meal high fat food ( rapeseed oil ) high protein food ( chicken breast ) fat , protein salad together add meal . Furthermore , study predict measured GI value mixed meal differ . - examine effect two different coffee portion glucose caffeine-containing soft drink postprandial glucose insulin response . Further objectives study coffee different accompaniment affect glucose insulin response . - measure GI value typical Finnish food - study effect berry glycemic insulinemic response - examine effect overweight glucose tolerance glucose , insulin lipid response HGI meal LGI meal.Furthermore , second aim study effect BMI glucose tolerance GI measure . - compare methodological choice insulin measurement - investigate effect alcohol postprandial glucose insulin response , determine glycemic insulinemic index value beer non-alcoholic beer
DOC.criteria: For Studies 19 total 12 24 volunteer per study normal glucose tolerance base upon 2 h 75g oral glucose tolerance test ( OGTT ) . For Study 7 total 24 volunteer impair glucose tolerance base OGTT . For Studies 16 89 age 20 60 BMI 18 30 kg/m2 . For Study 7 age 62 72 BMI 20 35 kg/m2 . Firstdegree family history diabetes An active gastrointestinal metabolic disease For Studies 16 89 chronic medication ( oral contraceptive allow ) For Study 7 regular medication would affect glucose lipid metabolism Smoking Pregnancy Breastfeeding History polycystic ovary syndrome History gestational diabetes
